result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Transcript from 10/25/2022 plea and sentencing hearing
to Defendant -- per 10/25/22 Judgment of Dismissal. 22C 014355
Appearance in court

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #[21CM305, #21CM306, #21CT63, #21CT393, #22CF7, #22CF133 called at 11:00am
Defendant Charles L Belcour appears from Dodge Correctional Institution, in custody. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for State of Wisconsin.  
The Court finds the Zoom video-connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.
The Court verifies with Mr. Belcour that he understands he has the right to be present in the courtroom for sentencing, and he is waiving this right. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; Elements are recited; pleas of " Guilty" are entered in Case #22CF133-Count #1,  and in Case #21CM305, and in Case #21CT393; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the pleas, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses the other counts and cases [Count #2 in Case #22CF133; Cases #21CM306, #21CT63, #22CF7.]

In Case #22CF133-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Belcour to:
--serve 90 days in County Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System; consecutive to #21CM305 and #21CT393, and to any other sentences 
--5 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge. The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for court financial obligations. 
--the Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution in the amount of $672.32, in favor of Walmart 


In Case #21CM305 the Court sentences Mr. Belcour to:
--serve 90 days in County Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System; consecutive to #22CF133 and #21CT393, and to any other sentences 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge.  The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for court financial obligations. 


In Case #21CT393 the Court sentences Mr. Belcour to:
--serve 10 days in County Jail, to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System, consecutive #22CF133 and #21CM305, and to any other sentences 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--pay costs plus DNA surcharge.  The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for court financial obligations. 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings are given.  
recess 11:27am
w/ elements
criminal case settlement
Extradition Forecast

[MK] cases #[21CM305, #21CM306, #21CT63, #21CT393, #22CF7, #22CF133 called at 3:35pm
Defendant Charles L Belcour does not appear. Attorney Cassi Nelson was present in the courtroom at the scheduled hearing time, however she now appears by telephone. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  
These cases are scheduled for Plea & Sentencing today. Attorney Nelson has no explanation for the non-appearance; she has not been able to reach him by telephone today. 
On Motion of the State, the Court issues Bench Warrants--Body Only, returnable to any Jefferson County magistrate.
The Court directs that the trial-related dates are to remain on the Court's calendar in October. 
recess 3:37pm

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 25, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on October 31, 2022 at 08:15 am.

[MK] cases #21CM305, #21CM306, #21CT63, #21CT393, #22CF7, #22CF133 called at 2:41pm
Defendant Charles L Belcour appears by phone. Attorney Cassi Nelson appears in court. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for State of Wisconsin.  
The phone-format appearance of Mr. Belcour is unexpected. Attorney Nelson provides information that Mr. Belcour communicated with her earlier today to say he is ill and unable to travel to court. 
Attorney Nelson requests the scheduling of a projected plea and sentencing hearing.  
Mr. Belcour indicates that his address is:  W8049 High Ridge Road, Fort Atkinson. 
recess 2:45pm 

NEXT:  (1) clerk- remove the jail from the mailing matrix; Mr. Belcour is not in custody,  (2) Plea & Sentencing on September 8th at 2:00pm

Waiver of Prelim on April 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.

[MK] cases #21CM305, #21CM306, #21CT63, #21CT393, #22CF7, #22CF133 called at 8:58am 
Defendant Charles L Belcour in court, in custody.  ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases #22CF7 and #22CF133 are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings today, and the State's officer-witnesses are present.  
The Court notes that the Jefferson Public Defenders Office indicated yesterday that Mr. Belcour qualifies for PD representation, however they have not been able to appoint counsel for Mr. Belcour yet. 
Mr. Belcour indicates that he wishes to waive his right to preliminary hearings so that he can request speedy trials.  
After further discussion regarding right to counsel, the Court schedules the cases for status-of counsel and prospective prelim-waivers 
recess 9:02am

NEXT:  Status Conference (status-of-counsel hearing) in the misdemeanor cases, and Prelim-Waiver Hearings on the felony cases--all on April 26th at 9:15am
Not yet appointed counsel
Scheduling Order
Preliminary hearing on April 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Amended Bond. Conditions of this Bond include: 
--to maintain absolute sobriety

[MK] cases #21CM305, #21CM306, #21CT63, #21CT393, #22CF7, #22CF133 called briefly at 9:13am, and then at 9:28am, and then at 9:40am
Defendant Charles L Belcour in court, in custody, with Attorney Cassi Nelson (Attorney Nelson appears today for purposes of the Initial Appearances).  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
When the Court first called the cases, Mr. Belcour indicates that he has tried calling the Public Defender's Office, but no one responded.  During the recess Attorney Nelson, who was present in the courtroom gallery on separate matters, completed an eligibility review and determined that Mr. Belcour qualifies for Public Defender representation.  
Service of all Criminal Complaints is admitted, readings are waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
In Case #21CM305:  the Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
In the Misdemeanor cases:  Pleas of "Not Guilty" are entered, and the Defense preserves the right to speedy trials. 
In the Felony cases:  the Defense requests scheduling of the preliminary hearings within the time limit.  

In each of the misdemeanor cases the Court requires a $500 Signature Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. [Clerk's inserted noted:  In Cases #21CM305 and #21CM306 signed $500 Signature Bonds are already in place, so today's requirement only results in the amendment of bond in Cases #21CT63 and #21CT393].

In case #22CF7 the Court requires a $50 Cash Bond with the same conditions as previously ordered. 

In Case #22CF133 the Court requires a $100 Cash Bond with conditions: no presence at the Walmart in Jefferson; no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
recess 9:57am 

NEXT: (1) clerk-modify the mailing matrix for the incarceration address to be the Jefferson County Jail-- Mr. Belcour is now serving a six month Family Court Order commitment currently,  (2) Preliminary Hearing in the felony cases and Status Conference in the misdemeanor cases--all on April 5th at 9:00am  [JA- note in comments of the misdemeanor cases that speedy trials have been requested]
Initial appearance on March 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Notice of Court Order to Jefferson County Dispatch
Court Order

Conditions of Bond include:  
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall

[MK; Appearances are by Zoom Conference] 
cases #21CM305, #21CM306, #21CT63, #21CT393, #22CF7 called at 9:51am 
Defendant Charles L Belcour appears from the Milwaukee House of Corrections, in custody.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court addresses Bond in each case: 
--In Case #21CM305 the Court requires a $500 Signature Bond with condition:  to maintain absolute sobriety
--in Case #21CM306 the Court requires a $500 Signature Bond with condition:  to maintain absolute sobriety
--in Case #21CT63 the Court reinstates the Signature Bond 
--in Case #21CT393 the Court requires a $350 Signature Bond with condition:  not to drive a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license 
--in Case #22CF7 the Court requires a $100 Cash Bond with conditions:  to maintain absolute sobriety; no presence at the Johnson Creek Outlet Mall. 
The Court reviews right to counsel.  The Court requires Mr. Bellcour to telephone the Jefferson Public Defenders Office by 4:00pm to apply for representation. 
Mr. Belcour confirms that his address is W8049 High Ridge Road, Fort Atkinson when he is not in custody.  
recess 10:02am
[Post-Hearing/Off Record the Court quashes the Warrant in each case.]
